intro: Oxyspora acutangula, commonly known as the sharp-angled oxyspora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves with acute leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Oxyspora acutangula is often found in open woodlands and along forest edges, where it contributes to the local flora diversity.
